result.execSummary:
The defendant John Tou Moua was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Maintain Drug Trafficking Place, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.42(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: *Probation may be transferred to Winnebago County but defendant is to report to Probation and Parole in Stevens Point first

miscConds.notes:
*Pay costs
*Pay DNA Surcharge
*If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 50% of gross.
*Obtain and maintain full-time employment or schooling or a combination of both equaling full-time.

*Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
*Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
*Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.

*Use one (1) pharmacy to obtain prescriptions and disclose to agent and sign releases so agent can monitor prescription drug use.
*Submit DNA Sample
*2 days of pretrial incarceration credit if defendant gets revoked
*AODA & comply with treatment recommendations, if there are any

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. John Tou Moua

records.addlTxt: DISCHARGE - REGULAR

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
Defendant John Tou Moua in court with attorney Anne Renc. Michael Daniel Zell appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 

3:50 PM Court calls case.
Atty Zell states appearances.

Matter is set for a plea and sentencing.

There is a plea agreement.
Defendant will plead to Count 2.
Atty Renc concurs.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
Count 2: NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Renc for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Count 1: Dismissed and Read In
Count 2: Contrary to the statute section stated therein
Count 3: Dismissed and Read In
Count 4: Dismissed and Read In

Atty Zell makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Renc makes sentencing arguments to the Court, this is a joint recommendation.

Court has a number of factors to consider to determine sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
Count 2:
Sentence is Withheld
Probation for a period of 24 Months
Conditions:
AODA assessment and comply with treatment recommendations if there are any
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances
All prescriptions to be filled at one pharmacy
Sign all necessary releases for agent
Obtain and maintain full time employment or schooling or a combination of both to equal full time
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge
Submit DNA Sample
Probation may be transferred to Winnebago County but Defendant is to report at Probation and Parole in Stevens Point first
2 days of pretrial incarceration credit if Defendant gets revoked

20 days in which to appeal
Voting rights are addressed
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 27, 2017 at 03:45 pm.
Pre-trial conference on June 12, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Prior: 124 Minnesota Avenue, #6, Stevens Point, WI 54481

Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information.

BY THE COURT: Court finds it is probable that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it and binds the defendant over for trial.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 8, 2017 at 09:00 am.

BY THE COURT:  Warrant is quashed. 

State recommends a $1,000 cash bond with conditions as stated.
Atty McFarland makes bond arguments to the Court.  Defendant is currently employed by RR Donnelly in Menasha.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 13, 2017 at 01:30 pm.
